sentences.en: And trust in rising home value as a truism as reliable as a sunrise was a major contributor to the catastrophic collapse of the economy.
sentences.cn: 并且对于家庭价值作为真实性而信任，认为它和日出一样的可靠，这份信任是经济灾难性崩溃的主要贡献者。

sentences.en: His speech was just a collection of cliches and truisms.
sentences.cn: 他的演说就是一堆陈词滥调和自明之理。

sentences.en: It is an obvious truism that people act in accordance with their motives.
sentences.cn: 人人都按自己的动机行事是不言而喻的.

sentences.en: It is considered a truism that trends start here in California and move east.
sentences.cn: 人们认为的事实是趋势从这里的加利福尼亚开始并向东部扩散.

sentences.en: Now medical researchers are discovering another truism.
sentences.cn: 现在医学研究工作者又发现一条不言而喻的道理.

sentences.en: This has to be the most outrageous and annoying truism ever stated.
sentences.cn: 这必定是最愤怒,也是最讨厌的公理.

sentences.en: This observation is nearly a truism.
To say that the self is involved in judging others is in a truism.
sentences.cn: 对他人的评判中包含了自我,这一点已广为人知.

sentences.en: Today few disagree with the truism, " Our people are our greatest asset. "
sentences.cn: 今天,几乎没人不相信这一真理 “ 人是最好的资产 ”.

sentences.en: Whilst this might sound like a truism, it is nevertheless a crucial problem to address.
sentences.cn: 尽管这可能听起来像是老生常谈，但却是待解决的重要问题。

words.tran_cn: 自明之理；老生常谈；老套；众所周知；真实性

trans.tran_en: a statement that is clearly true, so that there is no need to say it
